dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependent_to.description:
Apple Rootless Window Management Extension. This extension defines a
protcol that allows X window managers to better interact with the Mac OS
X Aqua user interface when running X11 in a rootless mode.
dependent_to.name: applewmproto

dependent_to.description:
The appres program prints the resources seen by an application (or
subhierarchy of an application) with the specified class and instance
names. It can be used to determine which resources a particular program
will load.
dependent_to.name: appres

dependent_to.description:
bdftopcf is a font compiler for the X server and font server. Fonts in
Portable Compiled Format can be read by any architecture, although the
file is structured to allow one particular architecture to read them
directly without reformatting. This allows fast reading on the
appropriate machine, but the files are still portable (but read more
slowly) on other machines.
dependent_to.name: bdftopcf

dependent_to.description:
The beforelight program is a sample implementation of a screen saver for
X servers supporting the MIT-SCREEN-SAVER extension. It is only
recommended for use as a code sample, as it does not include features
such as screen locking or configurability.
dependent_to.name: beforelight

dependent_to.description:
Big Requests Extension. This extension defines a protocol to enable the
use of requests that exceed 262140 bytes in length.
dependent_to.name: bigreqsproto

dependent_to.description: bitmap, bmtoa, atobm - X bitmap (XBM) editor and converter utilities.
dependent_to.name: bitmap

dependent_to.description:
Composite Extension. This package contains header files and
documentation for the composite extension. Library and server
implementations are separate.
dependent_to.name: compositeproto

dependent_to.description:
constype prints on the standard output the Sun code for the type of
display that the specified device is. It was originally written for
SunOS, but has been ported to other SPARC OS'es and to Solaris on both
SPARC & x86.
dependent_to.name: constype

dependent_to.description:
X Damage Extension. This package contains header files and documentation
for the X Damage extension. Library and server implementations are
separate.
dependent_to.name: damageproto

dependent_to.description:
Distributed Multihead X (DMX) Extension. This extension defines a
protocol for clients to access a front-end proxy X server that controls
multiple back-end X servers making up a large display.
dependent_to.name: dmxproto

dependent_to.description:
Direct Rendering Infrastructure 2 Extension. This extension defines a
protocol to securely allow user applications to access the video
hardware without requiring data to be passed through the X server.
dependent_to.name: dri2proto

dependent_to.description:
Direct Rendering Infrastructure 3 Extension. This extension defines a
protocol to securely allow user applications to access the video
hardware without requiring data to be passed through the X server.
dependent_to.name: dri3proto

dependent_to.description: Dynamic resource editor for X Toolkit applications.
dependent_to.name: editres

dependent_to.description:
Extended Visual Information Extension (XEVIE). This extension defines a
protocol for a client to determine information about core X visuals
beyond what the core protocol provides.
dependent_to.name: evieext

dependent_to.description:
X Fixes Extension. The extension makes changes to many areas of the
protocol to resolve issues raised by application interaction with core
protocol mechanisms that cannot be adequately worked around on the
client side of the wire.
dependent_to.name: fixesproto

dependent_to.description: X.Org font package creation/installation utilities and fonts.
dependent_to.name: font-util

dependent_to.description: X Fonts Extension.
dependent_to.name: fontsproto

dependent_to.description: Wrap a bitmap font in a sfnt (TrueType) wrapper.
dependent_to.name: fonttosfnt

dependent_to.description: fslsfonts produces a list of fonts served by an X font server.
dependent_to.name: fslsfonts

dependent_to.description:
The fstobdf program reads a font from a font server and prints a BDF
file on the standard output that may be used to recreate the font. This
is useful in testing servers, debugging font metrics, and reproducing
lost BDF files.
dependent_to.name: fstobdf

dependent_to.description:
OpenGL Extension to the X Window System. This extension defines a
protocol for the client to send 3D rendering commands to the X server.
dependent_to.name: glproto

dependent_to.description:
The iceauth program is used to edit and display the authorization
information used in connecting with ICE. It operates very much like the
xauth program for X11 connection authentication records.
dependent_to.name: iceauth

dependent_to.description:
ico is a simple animation program that may be used for testing various
X11 operations and extensions. It displays a wire-frame rotating
polyhedron, with hidden lines removed, or a solid-fill polyhedron with
hidden faces removed.
dependent_to.name: ico

dependent_to.description:
X Input Extension. This extension defines a protocol to provide
additional input devices management such as graphic tablets.
dependent_to.name: inputproto

dependent_to.description:
Intel GPU Tools is a collection of tools for development and testing of
the Intel DRM driver. There are many macro-level test suites that get
used against the driver, including xtest, rendercheck, piglit, and
oglconform, but failures from those can be difficult to track down to
kernel changes, and many require complicated build procedures or
specific testing environments to get useful results. Therefore, Intel
GPU Tools includes low-level tools and tests specifically for
development and testing of the Intel DRM Driver.
dependent_to.name: intel-gpu-tools

dependent_to.description:
X Keyboard Extension. This extension defines a protcol to provide a
number of new capabilities and controls for text keyboards.
dependent_to.name: kbproto

dependent_to.description:
lbxproxy accepts client connections, multiplexes them over a single
connection to the X server, and performs various optimizations on the X
protocol to make it faster over low bandwidth and/or high latency
connections. Note that the X server source from X.Org no longer supports
the LBX extension, so this program is only useful in connecting to older
X servers.
dependent_to.name: lbxproxy

dependent_to.description:
AppleWM is a simple library designed to interface with the Apple-WM
extension. This extension allows X window managers to better interact
with the Mac OS X Aqua user interface when running X11 in a rootless
mode.
dependent_to.name: libapplewm

dependent_to.description:
libdmx - X Window System DMX (Distributed Multihead X) extension
library.
dependent_to.name: libdmx

dependent_to.description: libfontenc - font encoding library.
dependent_to.name: libfontenc

dependent_to.description:
libFS - X Font Service client library. This library is used by clients
of X Font Servers (xfs), such as xfsinfo, fslsfonts, and the X servers
themselves.
dependent_to.name: libfs

dependent_to.description: libICE - Inter-Client Exchange Library.
dependent_to.name: libice

dependent_to.description: liblbxutil - Low Bandwith X extension (LBX) utility routines.
dependent_to.name: liblbxutil

dependent_to.description: X version 10 backwards compatibility.
dependent_to.name: liboldx

dependent_to.description: Generic PCI access library.
dependent_to.name: libpciaccess

dependent_to.description: libSM - X Session Management Library.
dependent_to.name: libsm

dependent_to.description:
WindowsWM - Cygwin/X rootless window management extension. WindowsWM is
a simple library designed to interface with the Windows-WM extension.
This extension allows X window managers to better interact with the
Cygwin XWin server when running X11 in a rootless mode.
dependent_to.name: libwindowswm

dependent_to.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.
dependent_to.name: libx11

dependent_to.description:
The libXau package contains a library implementing the X11 Authorization
Protocol. This is useful for restricting client access to the display.
dependent_to.name: libxau

dependent_to.description:
Xaw is the X Athena Widget Set. Xaw is a widget set based on the X
Toolkit Intrinsics (Xt) Library.
dependent_to.name: libxaw

dependent_to.description:
Xaw3d is the X 3D Athena Widget Set. Xaw3d is a widget set based on the
X Toolkit Intrinsics (Xt) Library.
dependent_to.name: libxaw3d

dependent_to.description:
The X protocol C-language Binding (XCB) is a replacement for Xlib
featuring a small footprint, latency hiding, direct access to the
protocol, improved threading support, and extensibility.
dependent_to.name: libxcb

dependent_to.description:
libXcomposite - client library for the Composite extension to the X11
protocol.
dependent_to.name: libxcomposite

dependent_to.description: libXcursor - X Window System Cursor management library.
dependent_to.name: libxcursor

dependent_to.description: This package contains the library for the X Damage extension.
dependent_to.name: libxdamage

dependent_to.description: libXdmcp - X Display Manager Control Protocol library.
dependent_to.name: libxdmcp

dependent_to.description: Xevie - X Event Interception Extension (XEvIE).
dependent_to.name: libxevie

dependent_to.description: libXext - library for common extensions to the X11 protocol.
dependent_to.name: libxext

dependent_to.description:
This package contains header files and documentation for the XFIXES
extension. Library and server implementations are separate.
dependent_to.name: libxfixes

dependent_to.description:
libXfont provides the core of the legacy X11 font system, handling the
index files (fonts.dir, fonts.alias, fonts.scale), the various font file
formats, and rasterizing them. It is used by the X servers, the X Font
Server (xfs), and some font utilities (bdftopcf for instance), but
should not be used by normal X11 clients. X11 clients access fonts via
either the new API's in libXft, or the legacy API's in libX11.
dependent_to.name: libxfont

dependent_to.description:
libXfont provides the core of the legacy X11 font system, handling the
index files (fonts.dir, fonts.alias, fonts.scale), the various font file
formats, and rasterizing them. It is used by the X servers, the X Font
Server (xfs), and some font utilities (bdftopcf for instance), but
should not be used by normal X11 clients. X11 clients access fonts via
either the new API's in libXft, or the legacy API's in libX11.
dependent_to.name: libxfont2

dependent_to.description: Xfontcache - X-TrueType font cache extension client library.
dependent_to.name: libxfontcache

dependent_to.description:
X FreeType library. Xft version 2.1 was the first stand alone release of
Xft, a library that connects X applications with the FreeType font
rasterization library. Xft uses fontconfig to locate fonts so it has no
configuration files.
dependent_to.name: libxft

dependent_to.description: libXinerama - API for Xinerama extension to X11 Protocol.
dependent_to.name: libxinerama

dependent_to.description:
xkbcommon is a library to handle keyboard descriptions, including
loading them from disk, parsing them and handling their state. It's
mainly meant for client toolkits, window systems, and other system
applications.
dependent_to.name: libxkbcommon

dependent_to.description: XKB file handling routines.
dependent_to.name: libxkbfile

dependent_to.description: X.org libxkbui library.
dependent_to.name: libxkbui

dependent_to.description:
This library contains miscellaneous utilities and is not part of the
Xlib standard. It contains routines which only use public interfaces so
that it may be layered on top of any proprietary implementation of Xlib
or Xt.
dependent_to.name: libxmu

dependent_to.description: libXp - X Print Client Library.
dependent_to.name: libxp

dependent_to.description: libXpm - X Pixmap (XPM) image file format library.
dependent_to.name: libxpm

dependent_to.description:
This package contains header files and documentation for the Present
extension. Library and server implementations are separate.
dependent_to.name: libxpresent

dependent_to.description: Xprint application utility routines.
dependent_to.name: libxprintapputil

dependent_to.description: Xprint application utility routines.
dependent_to.name: libxprintutil

dependent_to.description: libXrandr - X Resize, Rotate and Reflection extension library.
dependent_to.name: libxrandr

dependent_to.description: libXrender - library for the Render Extension to the X11 protocol.
dependent_to.name: libxrender

dependent_to.description: libXRes - X-Resource extension client library.
dependent_to.name: libxres

dependent_to.description: XScreenSaver - X11 Screen Saver extension client library
dependent_to.name: libxscrnsaver

dependent_to.description:
libxshmfence - Shared memory 'SyncFence' synchronization primitive. This
library offers a CPU-based synchronization primitive compatible with the
X SyncFence objects that can be shared between processes using file
descriptor passing.
dependent_to.name: libxshmfence

dependent_to.description: libXt - X Toolkit Intrinsics library.
dependent_to.name: libxt

dependent_to.description:
libXTrap is the Xlib-based client API for the DEC-XTRAP extension. XTrap
was a proposed standard extension for X11R5 which facilitated the
capturing of server protocol and synthesizing core input events. Digital
participated in the X Consortium's xtest working group which chose to
evolve XTrap functionality into the XTEST & RECORD extensions for X11R6.
As X11R6 was released in 1994, XTrap has now been deprecated for over 15
years, and uses of it should be quite rare.
dependent_to.name: libxtrap

dependent_to.description:
libXtst provides the Xlib-based client API for the XTEST & RECORD
extensions. The XTEST extension is a minimal set of client and server
extensions required to completely test the X11 server with no user
intervention. This extension is not intended to support general
journaling and playback of user actions. The RECORD extension supports
the recording and reporting of all core X protocol and arbitrary X
extension protocol.
dependent_to.name: libxtst

dependent_to.description: libXv - library for the X Video (Xv) extension to the X Window System.
dependent_to.name: libxv

dependent_to.description: X.org libXvMC library.
dependent_to.name: libxvmc

dependent_to.description: libXxf86dga - Client library for the XFree86-DGA extension.
dependent_to.name: libxxf86dga

dependent_to.description: libXxf86misc - Extension library for the XFree86-Misc X extension.
dependent_to.name: libxxf86misc

dependent_to.description: libXxf86vm - Extension library for the XFree86-VidMode X extension.
dependent_to.name: libxxf86vm

dependent_to.description:
The listres program generates a list of X resources for a widget in an X
client written using a toolkit based on libXt.
dependent_to.name: listres

dependent_to.description:
Luit is a filter that can be run between an arbitrary application and a
UTF-8 terminal emulator such as xterm. It will convert application
output from the locale's encoding into UTF-8, and convert terminal input
from UTF-8 into the locale's encoding.
dependent_to.name: luit

dependent_to.description:
mkfontdir creates the fonts.dir files needed by the legacy X server core
font system. The current implementation is a simple wrapper script
around the mkfontscale program, which must be built and installed first.
dependent_to.name: mkfontdir

dependent_to.description:
mkfontscale creates the fonts.scale and fonts.dir index files used by
the legacy X11 font system.
dependent_to.name: mkfontscale

dependent_to.description:
oclock is a simple analog clock using the SHAPE extension to make a
round (possibly transparent) window.
dependent_to.name: oclock

dependent_to.description: Present protocol specification and Xlib/Xserver headers.
dependent_to.name: presentproto

dependent_to.description:
Xprint extension to the X11 protocol - a portable, network-transparent
printing system.
dependent_to.name: printproto

dependent_to.description:
The proxy manager (proxymngr) is responsible for resolving requests from
xfindproxy (and other similar clients), starting new proxies when
appropriate, and keeping track of all of the available proxy services.
The proxy manager strives to reuse existing proxies whenever possible.
dependent_to.name: proxymngr

dependent_to.description:
X Resize and Rotate Extension (RandR). This extension defines a protocol
for clients to dynamically change X screens, so as to resize, rotate and
reflect the root window of a screen.
dependent_to.name: randrproto

dependent_to.description:
X Record Extension. This extension defines a protocol for the recording
and playback of user actions in the X Window System.
dependent_to.name: recordproto

dependent_to.description:
rendercheck is a program to test a Render extension implementation
against separate calculations of expected output.
dependent_to.name: rendercheck

dependent_to.description:
X Rendering Extension. This extension defines the protcol for a digital
image composition as the foundation of a new rendering model within the
X Window System.
dependent_to.name: renderproto

dependent_to.description:
X Resource Extension. This extension defines a protocol that allows a
client to query the X server about its usage of various resources.
dependent_to.name: resourceproto

dependent_to.description:
This package includes both the client and server sides implementing the
protocol described in the "A Flexible Remote Execution Protocol Based on
rsh" paper found in the specs/ subdirectory. This software has been
deprecated in favor of the X11 forwarding provided in common ssh
implementations.
dependent_to.name: rstart

dependent_to.description: Various X related scripts.
dependent_to.name: scripts

dependent_to.description:
MIT Screen Saver Extension. This extension defines a protocol to control
screensaver features and also to query screensaver info on specific
windows.
dependent_to.name: scrnsaverproto

dependent_to.description:
Sessreg is a simple program for managing utmp/wtmp entries for X
sessions. It was originally written for use with xdm, but may also be
used with other display managers such as gdm or kdm.
dependent_to.name: sessreg

dependent_to.description:
setxkbmap is an X11 client to change the keymaps in the X server for a
specified keyboard to use the layout determined by the options listed on
the command line.
dependent_to.name: setxkbmap

dependent_to.description:
showfont displays data about a font from an X font server. The
information shown includes font information, font properties, character
metrics, and character bitmaps.
dependent_to.name: showfont

dependent_to.description:
smproxy allows X applications that do not support X11R6 session
management to participate in an X11R6 session.
dependent_to.name: smproxy

dependent_to.description: transset is an utility for setting opacity property.
dependent_to.name: transset

dependent_to.description:
twm is a window manager for the X Window System. It provides titlebars,
shaped windows, several forms of icon management, user-defined macro
functions, click-to-type and pointer-driven keyboard focus, and user-
specified key and pointer button bindings.
dependent_to.name: twm

dependent_to.description:
X Video Extension. This extension provides a protocol for a video output
mechanism, mainly to rescale video playback in the video controller
hardware.
dependent_to.name: videoproto

dependent_to.description:
viewres displays a tree showing the widget class hierarchy of the Athena
Widget Set (libXaw).
dependent_to.name: viewres

dependent_to.description: Simple X server performance benchmarker.
dependent_to.name: x11perf

dependent_to.description:
The xauth program is used to edit and display the authorization
information used in connecting to the X server.
dependent_to.name: xauth

dependent_to.description:
Xbacklight is used to adjust the backlight brightness where supported.
It uses the RandR extension to find all outputs on the X server
supporting backlight brightness control and changes them all in the same
way.
dependent_to.name: xbacklight

dependent_to.description:
xbiff provides graphical notification of new e-mail. It only handles
mail stored in a filesystem accessible file, not via IMAP, POP or other
remote access protocols.
dependent_to.name: xbiff

dependent_to.description:
The xbitmaps package contains bitmap images used by multiple
applications built in Xorg.
dependent_to.name: xbitmaps

dependent_to.description:
xcalc is a scientific calculator X11 client that can emulate a TI-30 or
an HP-10C.
dependent_to.name: xcalc

dependent_to.description:
xclipboard is used to collect and display text selections that are sent
to the CLIPBOARD by other clients. It is typically used to save
CLIPBOARD selections for later use. It stores each CLIPBOARD selection
as a separate string, each of which can be selected.
dependent_to.name: xclipboard

dependent_to.description:
xclock is the classic X Window System clock utility. It displays the
time in analog or digital form, continuously updated at a frequency
which may be specified by the user.
dependent_to.name: xclock

dependent_to.description:
XC-MISC Extension. This extension defines a protocol that provides Xlib
two ways to query the server for available resource IDs.
dependent_to.name: xcmiscproto

dependent_to.description:
xcmsdb is used to load, query, or remove Device Color Characterization
data stored in properties on the root window of the screen as specified
in section 7, Device Color Characterization, of the X11 Inter-Client
Communication Conventions Manual (ICCCM).
dependent_to.name: xcmsdb

dependent_to.description:
xcompmgr is a sample compositing manager for X servers supporting the
XFIXES, DAMAGE, RENDER, and COMPOSITE extensions. It enables basic eye-
candy effects.
dependent_to.name: xcompmgr

dependent_to.description:
xconsole displays in a X11 window the messages which are usually sent to
/dev/console.
dependent_to.name: xconsole

dependent_to.description:
This is a default set of cursor themes for use with libXcursor,
originally created for the XFree86 Project, and now shipped as part of
the X.Org software distribution.
dependent_to.name: xcursor-themes

dependent_to.description: xcursorgen prepares X11 cursor sets for use with libXcursor.
dependent_to.name: xcursorgen

dependent_to.description:
xdbedizzy is a demo of the X11 Double Buffer Extension (DBE) creating a
double buffered spinning scene.
dependent_to.name: xdbedizzy

dependent_to.description: xditview displays ditroff output on an X display.
dependent_to.name: xditview

dependent_to.description: X Display Manager / XDMCP server.
dependent_to.name: xdm

dependent_to.description:
xdpyinfo is a utility for displaying information about an X server. It
is used to examine the capabilities of a server, the predefined values
for various parameters used in communicating between clients and the
server, and the different types of screens, visuals, and X11 protocol
extensions that are available.
dependent_to.name: xdpyinfo

dependent_to.description: xdriinfo - query configuration information of X11 DRI drivers.
dependent_to.name: xdriinfo

dependent_to.description: Xedit is a simple text editor for X.
dependent_to.name: xedit

dependent_to.description:
xev creates a window and then asks the X server to send it X11 events
whenever anything happens to the window (such as it being moved,
resized, typed in, clicked in, etc.). You can also attach it to an
existing window. It is useful for seeing what causes events to occur and
to display the information that they contain; it is essentially a
debugging and development tool, and should not be needed in normal
usage.
dependent_to.name: xev

dependent_to.description: X Protocol Extensions.
dependent_to.name: xextproto

dependent_to.description: xeyes - a follow the mouse X demo, using the X SHAPE extension
dependent_to.name: xeyes

dependent_to.description: dga is a simple test client for the XFree86-DGA extension.
dependent_to.name: xf86dga

dependent_to.description:
XFree86 Direct Rendering Infrastructure Extension. This extension
defines a protocol to allow user applications to access the video
hardware without requiring data to be passed through the X server.
dependent_to.name: xf86driproto

dependent_to.description:
XFree86 Video Mode Extension. This extension defines a protocol for
dynamically configuring modelines and gamma.
dependent_to.name: xf86vidmodeproto

dependent_to.description:
xfd - display all the characters in a font using either the X11 core
protocol or libXft2.
dependent_to.name: xfd

dependent_to.description:
xfindproxy is used to locate available X11 proxy services. It utilizes
the Proxy Management Protocol to communicate with a proxy manager. The
proxy manager keeps track of all available proxy services, starts new
proxies when necessary, and makes sure that proxies are shared whenever
possible.
dependent_to.name: xfindproxy

dependent_to.description:
xfontsel application provides a simple way to display the X11 core
protocol fonts known to your X server, examine samples of each, and
retrieve the X Logical Font Description ("XLFD") full name for a font.
dependent_to.name: xfontsel

dependent_to.description: X Font Server.
dependent_to.name: xfs

dependent_to.description:
xfsinfo is a utility for displaying information about an X font server.
It is used to examine the capabilities of a server, the predefined
values for various parameters used in communicating between clients and
the server, and the font catalogues and alternate servers that are
available.
dependent_to.name: xfsinfo

dependent_to.description: xfwp proxies X11 protocol connections, such as through a firewall.
dependent_to.name: xfwp

dependent_to.description:
xgamma allows X users to query and alter the gamma correction of a
monitor via the X video mode extension (XFree86-VidModeExtension).
dependent_to.name: xgamma

dependent_to.description:
xgc is an X11 graphics demo that shows various features of the X11 core
protocol graphics primitives.
dependent_to.name: xgc

dependent_to.description:
xhost is used to manage the list of host names or user names allowed to
make connections to the X server.
dependent_to.name: xhost

dependent_to.description:
X Xinerama Extension. This is an X extension that allows multiple
physical screens controlled by a single X server to appear as a single
screen.
dependent_to.name: xineramaproto

dependent_to.description:
The xinit program is used to start the X Window System server and a
first client program on systems that are not using a display manager
such as xdm.
dependent_to.name: xinit

dependent_to.description: xinput is a utility to configure and test XInput devices.
dependent_to.name: xinput

dependent_to.description:
The X Keyboard (XKB) Extension essentially replaces the core protocol
definition of a keyboard. The extension makes it possible to specify
clearly and explicitly most aspects of keyboard behaviour on a per-key
basis, and to track more closely the logical and physical state of a
keyboard. It also includes a number of keyboard controls designed to
make keyboards more accessible to people with physical impairments.
dependent_to.name: xkbcomp

dependent_to.description: XKB event daemon demo.
dependent_to.name: xkbevd

dependent_to.description:
xkbprint generates a printable or encapsulated PostScript description of
an XKB keyboard description.
dependent_to.name: xkbprint

dependent_to.description:
xkbutils is a collection of small utilities utilizing the XKeyboard
(XKB) extension to the X11 protocol.
dependent_to.name: xkbutils

dependent_to.description:
xkill is a utility for forcing the X server to close connections to
clients. This program is very dangerous, but is useful for aborting
programs that have displayed undesired windows on a user's screen.
dependent_to.name: xkill

dependent_to.description:
xload displays a periodically updating histogram of the system load
average.
dependent_to.name: xload

dependent_to.description: The xlogo program simply displays the X Window System logo.
dependent_to.name: xlogo

dependent_to.description: xlsatoms lists the interned atoms defined on an X11 server.
dependent_to.name: xlsatoms

dependent_to.description:
xlsclients is a utility for listing information about the client
applications running on a X11 server.
dependent_to.name: xlsclients

dependent_to.description:
xlsfonts lists fonts available from an X server via the X11 core
protocol.
dependent_to.name: xlsfonts

dependent_to.description: xmag displays a magnified snapshot of a portion of an X11 screen.
dependent_to.name: xmag

dependent_to.description:
xman is a graphical manual page browser using the Athena Widgets (Xaw)
toolkit.
dependent_to.name: xman

dependent_to.description:
xmessage displays a message or query in a window. The user can click on
an "okay" button to dismiss it or can select one of several buttons to
answer a question. xmessage can also exit after a specified time.
dependent_to.name: xmessage

dependent_to.description:
The xmh program provides a graphical user interface to the MH Message
Handling System. To actually do things with your mail, it makes calls to
the MH package.
dependent_to.name: xmh

dependent_to.description:
The xmodmap program is used to edit and display the keyboard modifier
map and keymap table that are used by client applications to convert
event keycodes into keysyms. It is usually run from the user's session
startup script to configure the keyboard according to personal tastes.
dependent_to.name: xmodmap

dependent_to.description: xmore - plain text display program for the X Window System.
dependent_to.name: xmore

dependent_to.description:
This package provides miscellaneous documentation for the X Window
System that doesn't better fit into other packages. The preferred
documentation format for these documents is DocBook XML.
dependent_to.name: xorg-docs

dependent_to.description:
Provides a Google Test environment for starting and stopping a X server
for testing purposes.
dependent_to.name: xorg-gtest

dependent_to.description:
X.Org Server is the free and open source implementation of the display
server for the X Window System stewarded by the X.Org Foundation.
dependent_to.name: xorg-server

dependent_to.description:
This package provides a common set of SGML entities and XML/CSS style
sheets used in building/formatting the documentation provided in other
X.Org packages.
dependent_to.name: xorg-sgml-doctools

dependent_to.description: X Window System unified protocol definitions replacing standalone protos
dependent_to.name: xorgproto

dependent_to.description: Xprint sample applications.
dependent_to.name: xphelloworld

dependent_to.description: List Xprint printers.
dependent_to.name: xplsprinters

dependent_to.description:
xpr takes as input a window dump file produced by xwd and formats it for
output on various types of printers.
dependent_to.name: xpr

dependent_to.description: Rehash list of Xprint printers.
dependent_to.name: xprehashprinterlist

dependent_to.description:
xprop is a command line tool to display and/or set window and font
properties of an X server.
dependent_to.name: xprop

dependent_to.description:
X Window System Core Protocol. This package provides the headers and
specification documents defining the X Window System Core Protocol,
Version 11. It also includes a number of headers that aren't purely
protocol related, but are depended upon by many other X Window System
packages to provide common definitions and porting layer.
dependent_to.name: xproto

dependent_to.description:
xrandr - primitive command line interface to X11 Resize, Rotate, and
Reflect (RandR) extension.
dependent_to.name: xrandr

dependent_to.description: xrdb - X server resource database utility.
dependent_to.name: xrdb

dependent_to.description: xrefresh - refresh all or part of an X screen.
dependent_to.name: xrefresh

dependent_to.description:
The remote execution (RX) service specifies a MIME format for invoking
applications remotely, for example via a World Wide Web browser. This RX
format specifies a syntax for listing network services required by the
application, for example an X display server. The requesting Web browser
must identify specific instances of the services in the request to
invoke the application.
dependent_to.name: xrx

dependent_to.description: XSCOPE -- a program to monitor X11/Client conversations.
dependent_to.name: xscope

dependent_to.description: User preference utility for X.
dependent_to.name: xset

dependent_to.description: Set the mode for an X Input device.
dependent_to.name: xsetmode

dependent_to.description: Set an X Input device as the main pointer.
dependent_to.name: xsetpointer

dependent_to.description: xsetroot - root window parameter setting utility for X.
dependent_to.name: xsetroot

dependent_to.description: X Session Manager.
dependent_to.name: xsm

dependent_to.description:
The xstdcmap utility can be used to selectively define standard colormap
properties. It is intended to be run from a user's X startup script to
create standard colormap definitions in order to facilitate sharing of
scarce colormap resources among clients using PseudoColor visuals.
dependent_to.name: xstdcmap

dependent_to.description:
xtrans is a library of code that is shared among various X packages to
handle network protocol transport in a modular fashion, allowing a
single place to add new transport types. It is used by the X server,
libX11, libICE, the X font server, and related components.
dependent_to.name: xtrans

dependent_to.description: XTrap sample clients.
dependent_to.name: xtrap

dependent_to.description:
This is a revamped version of X Test Suite (XTS) which removes some of
the ugliness of building and running the tests.
dependent_to.name: xts

dependent_to.description:
xvidtune is a client interface to the X server video mode extension
(XFree86-VidModeExtension).
dependent_to.name: xvidtune

dependent_to.description:
xvinfo prints out the capabilities of any video adaptors associated with
the display that are accessible through the X-Video extension.
dependent_to.name: xvinfo

dependent_to.description: xwd - dump an image of an X window.
dependent_to.name: xwd

dependent_to.description:
xwininfo prints information about windows on an X server. Various
information is displayed depending on which options are selected.
dependent_to.name: xwininfo

dependent_to.description:
xwud allows X users to display in a window an image saved in a specially
formatted dump file, such as produced by xwd.
dependent_to.name: xwud

description:
This is a set of autoconf macros used by the configure.ac scripts in
other Xorg modular packages, and is needed to generate new versions of
their configure scripts with autoconf.
name: util-macros

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
